header.title: The New Hermetics: 21st Century Magick for Illumination and Power

central_thesis: The New Hermetics presents a powerful, systematic 'spiritual technology' that synthesizes ancient Hermetic, Qabalistic, and magical traditions with modern psychological models (Neuro-linguistic Programming, Jungian psychology, Timothy Leary's 8-circuit model) to provide a comprehensive, progressive program for expanding consciousness, achieving self-mastery, manifesting desired realities, and ultimately attaining 'cosmic consciousness'. It emphasizes direct experience and practical operative magic as a means of personal transformation and gaining power over one's internal and external worlds.

structure_content.summary: Lon Milo DuQuette introduces the work as a significant modern synthesis of ancient magical wisdom with contemporary thought, positioning it as a practical guide for 'magical evolution' accessible to both novices and advanced practitioners seeking profound self-transformation and the ability to affect reality.

This section outlines the core premise: The New Hermetics is an instructional system for exploring subjective consciousness, combining esoteric traditions with psychology (Jung, NLP, Leary) and Scientific Illuminism. It aims to develop a 'dependable system for magically changing our lives' and is structured across ten progressive levels of attainment, from Initiate to Ultimate Master, focusing on practical transformation rather than dogma.

This chapter introduces the fundamental philosophy, defining Hermeticism as a path to cosmic consciousness and personal transformation. It encourages skepticism towards dogma while fostering an open mind to possibility and subjective truth. Key conceptual models are introduced, including Equilibrium, The Qabalistic Tree of Life, Jungian archetypes, NLP, and Leary's 8-circuit model, laying the groundwork for the integrated system.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 2: Ancient Models for the New Hermetics
structure_content.summary: Newcomb details the historical and traditional roots of the system. Concepts explored include Self-Mastery ('Know Thyself'), the Macrocosm and Microcosm principle, the Four Elements (Fire, Water, Air, Earth) with their psychological correspondences, Sacred Numbers and Geometry, Alchemical principles (Sulphur, Mercury, Salt), Gnosis, the Qabalistic Tree of Life (Sephiroth and Paths), the Tetragrammaton, and the four worlds/parts of the soul. These ancient frameworks provide a symbolic and structural basis for the system.

structure_content.chapter_title: Chapter 3: Modern Models for the New Hermetics
structure_content.summary: This chapter integrates contemporary psychological frameworks into the Hermetic system. It delves into Neuro-linguistic Programming (NLP), explaining representational systems (VAKOG), submodalities, anchoring, and reframing. It also explores psychological metaphors from Jung (collective unconscious, archetypes), Reich (orgone energy), and Leary (8-circuit model of consciousness). Magick is defined as an applied spiritual science, emphasizing its psychological and transformative aspects.

This chapter describes the overall structure of the New Hermetics program, which consists of ten progressive levels. It introduces the concept of the 'Altered State'—a foundational trance or meditative state—as essential for all magical work. It also details the initial 'Initiation' ritual, which serves as a symbolic and energetic gateway into the system, emphasizing practical engagement over passive study.

This level focuses on foundational practical skills. It covers 'The Power of Goals' (setting and achieving objectives), 'Visualization Power' (creating and manipulating inner realities, including the 'Inner Temple'), 'Astral Travel' techniques, 'Meeting with your Inner Teacher' for guidance, and 'New Hermetics Grounding and Centering' (a modified LBRP). It also introduces initial work with 'The Four Elements' for personality balancing and 'Reframing Pain into Pleasure' using NLP.

The Zealot Level addresses emotional transformation. Techniques include 'Death and Rebirth' (confronting fears, past lives), 'Dissolving Negative Emotions' (using NLP submodalities), 'Anchoring Positive Emotions' (creating triggers for desired states), various 'Pranayama' (breathing exercises) for energy manipulation, and 'Manifesting Synchronicity' through creative visualization methods, notably the 'movie screen' technique for manifesting desires.

This level delves into advanced energy work and belief manipulation. It includes continued goal work, 'Exploring Archetypes' through Tarot, 'Accessing your Magical Memory' (past-life regression), and techniques for 'Changing Your Beliefs' using NLP. Practical applications extend to 'Projection of Energy to Charge Spaces', 'Creating Artificial Elementals' (thought-forms), 'Expanding Your Consciousness to Fill the Universe', and 'Silencing Your Mind' through meditation.

The Philosopher Level explores deeper magical theory and practical application. Topics include the interplay of 'Magick, Mysticism, and Magnetism', 'The Shapes of Magick' (geometric forms and their correspondences for talismanic work), precise methods for 'Creating Sigils and Talismans', advanced 'Exploring Archetypes' (invoking deities), developing 'Intuition and ESP', understanding and restructuring 'Value Hierarchies', 'Breath Awareness—Mahasatipatthana' (mindfulness), and 'Rising on the Planes' (astral projection).

The Adept Level focuses on integrating inner harmony and spiritual connection. Practices include 'Creating Inner Harmony' (aligning goals and values), 'Conscious Communion with Cosmic Consciousness' (deep meditative union), 'Conquering Your Demons' (integrating negative psychological patterns), 'Radiating Rosicrucian Love' (cultivating universal compassion), and 'Balancing Your Power' (integrating personal will with spiritual principles).

This final chapter provides a brief overview of the higher, more advanced levels of the New Hermetics program beyond the Adept: Advanced Adept, Perfect Adept, Master, Mage, and Ultimate Master. It describes the scope of training at these levels, including problem-solving, undoing past experiences, advanced invoking and evocation, and the mastery of spiritual forces, hinting at continued self-transformation.

key_concepts.definition: A comprehensive system synthesizing ancient Hermetic and Qabalistic magic with modern psychological models (NLP, Jungian psychology, Timothy Leary's 8-circuit model) for self-transformation, consciousness expansion, and the conscious manifestation of reality.

A foundational mental state of deep relaxation and focused concentration, akin to self-hypnosis or trance, which is essential for conducting all magical operations and accessing deeper levels of consciousness.
A vividly visualized sacred space constructed within the magician's mind, serving as a personal sanctuary and a flexible environment for performing ritual, visualization, and inner exploration.

An ancient mystical system, utilized as a symbolic map of consciousness, the universe, and divine emanations. It is integrated into the New Hermetics framework to provide structure for understanding levels of reality and archetypal energies.

A modern psychological methodology employed to understand and systematically change subjective experience through specific techniques involving sensory modalities (VAKOG), submodalities (qualities of internal representations), anchoring (creating stimulus-response links), and reframing (altering the meaning of experiences).

A psychological model of consciousness developed by Timothy Leary, outlining eight potential 'circuits' or levels of neurological awareness. It is used within the system to map and navigate different states of being and stages of personal evolution.

Universal, primal patterns and images originating from the collective unconscious (Jungian concept). These are explored and utilized through various means, including Tarot, mythological figures, and the invocation of deities, to access deep psychological and energetic currents.

Magical symbols (sigils) and charged objects (talismans) created through precise visualization, geometric forms, and the application of elemental/planetary correspondences. They are designed to embody specific intentions and facilitate their manifestation in reality.

Techniques utilizing the four classical elements (Fire, Water, Air, Earth) and their associated qualities to understand, categorize, and therapeutically balance personality traits and energetic flows within the individual.

A key technique involving detailed visualization, often using a 'movie screen' metaphor within the Inner Temple, to impress desired outcomes onto the subconscious mind, thereby influencing and orchestrating their manifestation in the external world through meaningful coincidences.

Created mental constructs or 'tulpas' imbued with specific intentions, energies, and consciousness. They are designed to carry out specific tasks or to serve as autonomous agents of the magician's will.

practical_system.description: The New Hermetics outlines a progressive, ten-level instructional system designed for deep personal transformation and mastery over one's inner and outer reality. Each level (Initiate, Zealot, Practitioner, Philosopher, Adept, Advanced Adept, Perfect Adept, Master, Mage, Ultimate Master) builds upon the previous one, introducing increasingly complex tools and techniques. The system's core operative principle is to intentionally alter subjective experience—often through an 'Altered State' of focused concentration—to affect consciousness and, by extension, reality. It emphasizes direct experience, constant practice, and a synthesis of traditional occult rituals with modern psychological 'technologies' like NLP, making it a highly actionable and customizable magical framework.
tools: Altered State: The foundational mental state (deep relaxation, focused concentration) used for all magical operations.
Visualization: Extensive use of mental imagery, including the 'Inner Temple', globes of light, 'movie screen' techniques for manifestation, elemental forms, and archetypal figures.

NLP Techniques: Application of representational systems (VAKOG), submodalities (e.g., changing image size, color, sound qualities), anchoring (creating triggers for desired states), and reframing (changing perception of experiences).

Pranayama (Breathing Exercises): Various breath control techniques (Complete Yogic Breath, Kapalabhati, Clearing Blocks, Charging Chakras) for energy manipulation, emotional regulation, and consciousness alteration.

Elemental Balancing: Working with the Four Elements (Fire, Water, Air, Earth) and their associated qualities to diagnose, understand, and therapeutically balance personality traits and energetic flows.
Sigil and Talisman Creation: Methods for designing and charging symbolic representations of intent using geometric forms and planetary/elemental correspondences.
Tarot Cards: Utilized as a symbolic tool for exploring archetypes, self-analysis, and understanding energetic patterns.
Journaling: Recommended for tracking insights, progress, and the outcomes of magical operations.
Body Posture & Gesture: Specific physical positions and hand gestures are used in anchoring and elemental work to enhance magical effects and embody states.
rituals: Initiation: Basic visualization of a globe of light descending into the body.
New Hermetics Grounding and Centering: A modified Lesser Banishing Ritual of the Pentagram (LBRP) involving visualizing crosses of light, projecting pentagrams, and invoking elemental guardians.
Invoking the Gods: Techniques for connecting with and embodying archetypal energies of various pantheons (Greek/Roman, Egyptian, Hindu, Nordic) through visualization and identification.
The Bornless Ritual (Appendix 5): A powerful ritual for self-identification with the 'bornless one' (universal consciousness), asserting command over elemental and spiritual forces.
Rising on the Planes: A form of astral projection and consciousness ascension through the Qabalistic planes and inner worlds.

relevant_quotes.text: The New Hermetics is a powerful new spiritual technology for the mind that teaches the science of illumination and the ability to alter reality.

One of the most consistently original new voices in the field, Jason Newcomb has taken the ancient tradition of Hermeticism a major step forward with The New Hermetics. His creative fusion of Western esoteric traditions with cutting-edge understandings of mind and thought has much to offer the Hermetic novice as well as the more advanced student of the Great Art.
The New Hermetics is a system for getting in touch with cosmic, universal consciousness, and eventually experiencing transcendental, ecstatic union with this consciousness.

The new Hermetics progressively gives initiates power over their minds and their world. In a fraction of the time it takes using traditional methods, this book lets practitioners master their minds to begin to achieve anything and everything they want in life—spiritually and physically.
Magick is the science of illumination and the art of alteration.
The New Hermetics is a system of Magick. Magick is a tool for causing miraculous changes in the world through invisible or extraordinary means.

critical_analysis.relevance: The New Hermetics offers a highly relevant and accessible system for modern practitioners of Western Esotericism and Magick. By skillfully integrating foundational Hermetic and Qabalistic principles with contemporary psychological models like NLP, Jungian archetypes, and Leary's 8-circuit model, it provides a structured, results-oriented path for personal transformation. This synthesis addresses the common modern desire for spiritual development that is both empirically grounded in personal experience and free from dogmatic constraints, bridging ancient wisdom with a scientific understanding of the mind. Its emphasis on operative techniques and progressive mastery ensures its continued practical utility.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for 'The New Hermetics' includes individuals seeking a comprehensive, structured, and practical system of Western Esotericism and Magick. This encompasses beginners looking for a clear, step-by-step curriculum to learn foundational and advanced magical techniques, as well as experienced practitioners interested in integrating modern psychological insights into their magical practice. It specifically appeals to those who value self-mastery, consciousness expansion, and the direct application of magical principles for personal and worldly manifestation, often described as '21st century magickians' who appreciate a blend of spiritual and scientific approaches.
